column4: hi everyone ... here's my problem ... i made a mistake by raising my monitor resolution to 1280x1024 ... but my monitor says that the refresh rate is too high .. so i cannot see anything on the screen ... i cannot see the login box ... i know i have to edit the resolution manually by modifying /etc/X11/xorg.conf ... but i cannot get to it (on my ext3 partition) even with the LIVE Kubuntu CD.. help!
ctrl alt f1 will switch yo to a virutal terminal that should allow you to log in via console
just reboot to the installed system
once the system has booted then type ctrl alt f1
you DO NOT HAVE TO DO THAT
mkdir: cannot create directory `mnt/F': No such file or directory
reboot to the installed system, take the live cd out
so when my monitor goes blank at login .. ctrl+alt+F1 .. then edit xorg.conf .. right? change the first resolution to something like "1024x768" right?
exactly
cool ty
i told you to reboot and not use the live cd
ok, i wont bother helping you seeing as you are to ignorant to listen
stop spamming
sorry .. but i only want to learn
of course
if you really must run that installer which may break your system then do sh ./path/to/installer.bin
i am about to restart and do as u told me to ... but i just need to know whether mount command works in a Live environment.. thts all .. i know my monitor problem was solved by u
yes it does, you just need to create the directory that you intend to mount somthing on first
mount whatever /mnt/A doesnt work because /mnt/A doesnt exist
you need root access to mkdir in /mnt
so sudo mkdir /mnt/A
btw i am not a spammer .. but i understood wht u must feel
np
ubotu is a bot, don't torment it :)
